sen.j: 壱志濃王（いちしのおう、天平5年（733年） - 延暦24年11月12日_(旧暦)（805年12月6日））は、奈良時代後期・平安時代初期の皇族。
sen.e: Prince Ichishino (733 - December 6, 805) was a member of the Imperial family between the late Nara period and the early Heian period.

sen.j: 湯原親王の第2子で光仁天皇（湯原親王の兄）の甥にあたる。
sen.e: He was the second son of Imperial Prince Yuhara and the nephew of Emperor Konin (who was Imperial Prince Yuhara's elder brother).

sen.j: 光仁天皇即位後の朝廷で重きを成し、朝廷の重大な祭祀の使者には必ずと言っていいほど任じられた。
sen.e: After the Emperor Konin's enthronement, the Imperial court counted on Prince Ichishino; he was almost always appointed as the emissary for the important court rituals.

sen.j: 従兄弟にあたる桓武天皇とは酒飲み仲間であったと伝えられ、平安京遷都の際に賀茂大神と伊勢神宮への使者にも任じられている。
sen.e: It is said that his cousin Emperor Kanmu was a boon companion and he was appointed as the emissary for Kamo-jinja Shrine and Ise-jingu Shrine in the transfer of national capital to the city of Heian-kyo.

sen.e: In 798, he was awarded the rank of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and was appointed as dainagon (a chief councillor of state) danjoin (President of the Board of Censors); he died while in the post.

sen.e: Emperor Kanmu lamented over his death and he awarded the rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank) to Prince Ichishino.

sen.e: It is said that Prince Ichishino was bold and bighearted and did not mind the etiquette and formality.
